incidents.name: Degradation in service for the LeMUR /lemur/v3 endpoint

incident_updates.body: We have deployed a fix to address the unexpected increase in 5xx errors that we were seeing. This fix has eliminated the unexpected errors and the issue has now been resolved.
We have identified the root cause of the issue affecting some LeMUR requests and are currently working to deploy a fix.

We are continuing to investigate the issues resulting in higher-than-normal 5xx errors for our LeMUR endpoints. While there is an increase in 5xx errors, the majority of requests using LeMUR are still completing normally. We will continue to share updates here as we learn more.
We are currently investigating an issue that is causing some requests to the `/lemur/v3` endpoint to fail with a 5xx error. We will post additional updates here as we learn more.

Our team has identified the root cause of the issues that were affecting Real-Time earlier and have deployed a fix to address them. Users are once again able to initiate Real-Time sessions using temporary tokens and the FinalTranscript text will now contain the expected punctuation.

We are continuing to work on a fix for the original issue of not being able to initiate a Real-Time session when using temporary API tokens but we have also discovered another issue that is causing the FinalTranscript to not contain the proper punctuation. Our team is working to address this issue as well.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified an issue with our Real-Time transcription service that is preventing users who are using temporary API tokens from being able to initiate a Real-Time session.

incidents.name: Increase in processing times for Async transcription

incident_updates.body:
We wanted to reach back out to share more detailed information on the incidents that occurred on 8/7 and 8/8. These incidents were caused by separate issues  See the information below for a description of each issue and the steps taken to remedy them.

8/7  
Incident Cause  
An inefficient database usage pattern change was submitted and deployed on 8/2. Although inefficient, due to the standard load prior to deployment, no regression was detected. We encountered a new peak load on 8/7 which along with this inefficiency led to a large increase in latency \(turnaround times\) which was the incident faced this day.

Resolution  
We identified and reverted the database usage change committed on 8/2 that led to this slowdown.  
We upgraded our database instance size.

8/8  
Incident Cause  
A full table query was run against our write replica database as a team worked to transfer data to BigQuery for business intelligence tooling. This led to database contention and slowed down our production service.

Resolution  
We implemented more fine-grained controls and roles for database access along with an approval process to verify production database queries are run against the correct replica and will not impact customers.

If you have any questions about this information feel free to reach out to [support@assemblyai.com](mailto:support@assemblyai.com).
Processing times have remained in the normal range and this incident is being transitioned to resolved.

Processing times for our Async endpoint have returned to the normal range and remained there for the last ~15 minutes. We will be monitoring traffic to ensure continued good performance going forward.
We are currently seeing an increase in processing times for our Async API. Our Engineering team is actively investigating the issue and we will post additional updates as we learn more.

We wanted to reach back out to share more detailed information on the incidents that occurred on 8/7 and 8/8. These incidents were caused by separate issues  See the information below for a description of each issue and the steps taken to remedy them.

8/7  
Incident Cause  
An inefficient database usage pattern change was submitted and deployed on 8/2. Although inefficient, due to the standard load prior to deployment, no regression was detected. We encountered a new peak load on 8/7 which along with this inefficiency led to a large increase in latency \(turnaround times\) which was the incident faced this day.

Resolution  
We identified and reverted the database usage change committed on 8/2 that led to this slowdown.  
We upgraded our database instance size.

8/8  
Incident Cause  
A full table query was run against our write replica database as a team worked to transfer data to BigQuery for business intelligence tooling. This led to database contention and slowed down our production service.

Resolution  
We implemented more fine-grained controls and roles for database access along with an approval process to verify production database queries are run against the correct replica and will not impact customers.  
  
If you have any questions about this information feel free to reach out to support@assemblyai.com.

Processing times have now returned to the normal range. We will continue to monitor traffic to ensure good performance going forward but at this point, this degradation of service is being marked as resolved.

We are continuing to monitor the situation but we are seeing processing times go down as a result of the latest changes we deployed. While we are not quite back to the normal processing range yet, we are moving in that direction. We will continue to monitor processing times and update you again once we have fully returned to the normal range.

The earlier changes we implemented did not improve processing times in the way that we hoped. We have another potential fix for this issue that we are working to release into Production. We will share another update here once that fix is live and we have had time to monitor its impact.
We have made some changes to address the slower-than-normal processing times we have been seeing and are currently monitoring the results of those changes to measure improvement.

We are still working to identify the root cause of the slowdown but it looks to be related to database load, which is causing degraded performance and slower-than-expected processing times. Jobs are still completing but with longer than normal turnaround times.

We have seen some improvement in processing times but we are still operating a higher than usual times. We are continuing to identify the root cause of the issue and will provide further updates as we learn more.

We are currently seeing slower-than-normal turnaround times for our Async API. Our Engineering team is actively investigating the issue and we will share additional information here as it becomes available.

incidents.name: Longer than usual processing time for our Async endpoint

incident_updates.body: We have continued to see traffic to our Async endpoint completing without issue and within the expected processing times range. All backlog jobs have completed and this slowdown is now being marked as resolved.

We have released an update to address the slowdown we were seeing in Async traffic and are now seeing improvements in transcripts completed and processing times. It may take a period of time for any jobs that were queued as a part of this slowdown to be completed but we are seeing processing times returning to the normal range for new traffic. We will continue to monitor traffic and will post another update once the slowdown has been fully resolved.

We have identified an issue that is affecting processing times for requests sent to our Async endpoint. Jobs are still completing without error but processing times are higher than usual. Our Engineering team is working to release an update to address this issue and we expect to see improvement soon. We will share further updates here as we work to resolve this issue.

Processing times have remained in the normal range since changes were made earlier to address the slowdown and all transcripts that were queued as a result of the slowdown have now been completed.

Our team is currently running a post-mortem on this issue so that we can work to eliminate the chances of this type of issue happening again in the future. That information will be added to this incident as soon as it is available.

Our Engineering team has made changes to address the slowdown in traffic we were seeing earlier. Traffic is once again processing as expected. Some requests were queued as a result of the earlier slowdown but those requests are now being processed as well and should complete successfully but with a longer than normal processing time. We will post another update once all of these queued jobs have completed.
We are having an issue in production causing transcripts to be throttled after implementing some infrastructure changes. Out team is working on a fix.

Processing times have returned to the normal range and we are no longer seeing a slowdown in traffic. We will continue to monitor turnaround times going forward but at this point the issues causing the slowdown have been resolved.

We have deployed a fix to address the slowdown and are seeing processing times go down as a result. We will continue to monitor the impact of this change and provide continued updates as we work towards returning to normal processing times.

We have identified the root cause of the slowdown which is due to workers failing to scale as expected. We are currently working to deploy a change that we believe will resolve the issue. We will provide further updates as we monitor the results of the change we are deploying.

We are currently investigating an issue that is leading to longer than expected processing times. This issue is not currently leading to failed transcripts but jobs will take longer than usual to complete, which in some cases could lead to throttling. Our Engineering team is currently working to identify and address the root cause of this issue and we will share further updates here as they become available.

incidents.name: Potential longer than usual processing times and intermittent website issues

incident_updates.body: AWS is reporting a recovery of the earlier issue. We will continue to monitor API and website health going forward but we do not expect any further impact from the earlier issues.

We are currently monitoring an AWS issue that has led to some intermittent degradation of service for our API and our website: https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

API traffic is currently working normally but this issue could lead to occasional increases in turnaround time. This issue is also affecting some aspects of our website including our Playground.
The issue with slower-than-usual processing times has been resolved.

We have deployed a fix for the slower-than-usual turnaround times and are seeing response times return to the normal range. We will continue to monitor the situation to ensure continued solid performance.

Our Engineering team has identified an issue within the punctuation portion of our pipeline. As a result, transcripts are still completing; however, at a slower-than-expected turnaround time.

We are working towards releasing a resolution and will provide updates accordingly.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause as an issue with the latest AWS version of Boto3. We are working on a fix now and will have our systems back up in a few minutes.
Currently, our Async API is not accepting new requests. Our team is investigating this issue and working towards a solution.
This incident has been resolved.
Traffic is once again processing normally. Our team is monitoring the situation to ensure no further issues.
We are currently seeing slower than normal turnaround times for our Async API. Our team is investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We currently see degraded API performance; our team is investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The root cause of this issue has been identified, and our team is working on a solution.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved, and traffic is processing normally.
A fix has been implemented, and we are actively monitoring performance as the API begins to process new transcripts.
We are currently seeing transcriptions for our async API remaining in a queued status for long periods of time. We have identified the root cause and are now working to fix the issue.
We are currently seeing slowed transcription for async API. We have identified the root cause and are currently fixing the issue.
Empathize with those affected and let them know everything is operating as normal.
Let your users know once a fix is in place, and keep communication clear and precise.
As you continue to work through the incident, update your customers frequently.
When your product or service isnt functioning as expected, let your customers know by creating an incident. Communicate early, even if you dont know exactly whats going on.
